comment: The least common multiple of a triple of integers is the least common multiple of the third integer and the least common multiple of the first two integers. Although there would be a shorter proof using ~ lcmfunsn , this explicit proof (not based on induction) should be kept. (Proof modification is discouraged.) (Contributed by AV, 23-Aug-2020.)
